frame.name: Obscurity
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> is obscure, unnotable, and in general little-known. In the case of an eventive <fen>Entity</fen>, lack of fame entails a large number of people not being aware of the event's occurence; in the case of a concrete <fen>Entity</fen>, including humans, lack of fame entails non-awareness of existence.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Geoffrey Rush</fex> <ment>was</ment> <t>little</t> <t>known</t> <fex name="Place">outside his native Australia</fex> <fex name="Time">when he soared to international prominence</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> which is not widely known and rather obscure.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>A modifier expressing the degree of fame of the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is not well known.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Some specification of the circumstances under which the <fen>Entity</fen> is considered not to be famous.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that provides an explanation (via reasoning, causation, etc.) for the level of fame of the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition:
<def-root>The reason that the <fen>Entity</fen> is not famous.
<ex>Some tech companies are <t>little known</t> <fex name="rea">because they mostly operate behond the scenes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is not famous.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is not famous.
<ex>Certain academic works are <t>obscure</t> <fex name="pla">only in North America</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: obscure.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not important or well known.

lexUnit.name: recondite.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a subject or knowledge) obscure.
